info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:33PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Moffat County through 400 PM MDT... At 332 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Craig, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Moffat County, including the following locations... Fortification. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 84 and 86. Colorado 13 between mile markers 101 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
